document_title: Obesity level 1: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Obesity is a condition in which more fat accumulates in the body than normal. Usually obesity is related to genetic, physiological and environmental factors, combined with diet and physical activity. Among them, type 1 obesity is the most common and mildest form. Adults are diagnosed with stage 1 obesity when they have a BMI greater than or equal to 30. (1)
Previously, obesity was a common disease in high-income countries, but is now increasing significantly in developing countries, including Vietnam. Currently, the rate of obese adults in Vietnam is about 15%, of which the number of obese patients in Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City accounts for 18% of the total number of obesity cases nationwide.
